title: 110_hr3539
content: The "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Financing Act of 2007" is cited as the short title. It extends and modifies taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. The "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Financing Act of 2007" extends and modifies taxes on aviation-grade kerosene and aviation gasoline. The tax rate for aviation-grade kerosene is set at 35.9 cents per gallon, and for aviation gasoline, it is 24.1 cents per gallon. The tax rate for aviation-grade kerosene used in commercial aviation is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon. Amendments are made to differentiate between kerosene and aviation-grade kerosene in the tax code. The tax code is amended to differentiate between kerosene and aviation-grade kerosene, with changes made to various sections including 4081(a)(3)(A)(ii), 4081(a)(3)(A)(iv), and 4081(a)(3)(D). Additionally, section 4081(a)(4) is updated to specify "aviation-grade kerosene" and section 4081(d)(2) is modified to include references to subsections (a)(2)(A)(ii) and (a)(2)(A)(iv). The tax code is amended to differentiate between kerosene and aviation-grade kerosene in various sections, including 4081(a)(3)(A)(ii), 4081(a)(3)(A)(iv), and 4081(a)(3)(D). Changes are made to section 4081(d)(2) to specify the effective date as after September 30, 2011 for fuels taxes and transportation taxes on persons and property. Additionally, section 4082 is updated to replace "kerosene" with "aviation-grade kerosene" for exemptions related to aviation fuel. The tax code is amended to differentiate between kerosene and aviation-grade kerosene in various sections. Changes are made to the rate of tax on aviation fuel, specifying the rate of tax in effect for commercial aviation. The tax code is amended to differentiate between kerosene and aviation-grade kerosene in various sections, specifying the rate of tax for commercial aviation and refunds relating to aviation-grade kerosene. The tax code is amended to differentiate between kerosene and aviation-grade kerosene, specifying the rate of tax for commercial aviation and refunds related to aviation-grade kerosene. If the ultimate purchaser of kerosene waives the right to payment and assigns it to the ultimate vendor, the Secretary will pay the amount to the vendor if they meet certain requirements. The tax code is amended to specify refunds for aviation-grade kerosene not used in aviation, with the Secretary paying the amount of tax imposed on the fuel if used for non-aviation purposes. Conforming amendments are made to related sections of the code. The tax code is amended to specify refunds for aviation-grade kerosene not used in aviation, with the Secretary paying the amount of tax imposed on the fuel if used for non-aviation purposes. Amendments are made to sections of the code related to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. Amendments are made to the tax code regarding transfers to the trust fund, specifying refunds for aviation-grade kerosene not used in aviation. Amendments to the tax code include changes to sections 9503(b)(4) and 9503(c) related to aviation fuel taxes and transfers to the Trust Fund. Amendments to the tax code involve changes to aviation fuel taxes and transfers from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund for aviation-grade kerosene not used in aviation. Expenditures for air traffic control modernization are specified in the tax code, with funds allocated from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund for aviation-grade kerosene not used in commercial aviation. The amendments made by this section apply to fuels removed, entered, or sold after December 31, 2007, with specific tax rates for aviation gasoline used in non-commercial aviation. The effective date for certain amendments is the date of the enactment of the Act. The floor stocks tax on aviation fuel imposed on January 1, 2008, is calculated based on the tax rates before that date, with adjustments for previous taxes paid. The floor stocks tax on aviation fuel imposed on January 1, 2008, requires payment by April 30, 2008, as prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury. The tax liability falls on those holding aviation fuel on the specified date, with revenues transferred to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. The subsection imposes a tax on aviation fuel as per section 4081 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Aviation fuel includes aviation-grade kerosene and gasoline. It is considered held by a person if title has passed to them. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Treasury or delegate. There is an exception for exempt uses of the tax. The tax on aviation fuel does not apply to fuel held for exempt uses or if the amount held does not exceed 2,000 gallons on January 1, 2008. For exempt fuel not subject to aviation fuel tax, controlled groups are treated as one person as defined in section 1563 of the Code. Under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, principles similar to those in section 1563 of the Code apply to a group of nonincorporated persons under common control. All provisions of law, including penalties, apply to taxes. The regulations and penalties for taxes on aviation fuel also apply to floor stock taxes to the same extent as if imposed by the same section of the Code.
